Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Reza Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. There are many problems due to change of management of this hotel. As I have been told, personnels are not paid so most of them are not helpful. Breakfast and lunch are tasetless with limited choices. Most of the restaurant mentioned in their website are closed. There is a night club which plays music loud. At the chekout they wanted to charge us 92 Dhr for mini bar while we never used it. We talked to another person and he didn't ask anybody to check our minibar and we checked out. I think there is no clear rule in this hotel and staff request charges as they want. The only positive point about this hotel is that it is clean. The location is far from deira and you have long distance to restaurant or shopping centers in deira. I think you can easily find a 4 star hotel in the deira with better services and price

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever hotel. Don't spoil your vacation staying there.”
Reviews.Author: EdmundHL
Reviews.Content: BEWARE - THIS IS NOT SAME RAMADA AS THE RAMADA INTERNATIONAL CHAIN. We were staying with Xclusive apartments in Dubai and had plans to go to Abu Dhabi after that. However, we changed our plans and stayed in Dubai. As Xclusive did not have the room available so we had to make a last minute booking in Ramada. And this was our worst decision. Rude and arrogant staff, did not bother to keep us waiting for this long at the reception although we were a family of 4. We had taken 2 rooms for 4 adults ( 2 couples) but they gave us rooms with 2 single beds each !!! We requested them to change but nobody helped. We called for Kettle so that we can heat some water as had sore throat and did not want to drink cold water. Reception said we do not have kettle, if you want hot water we can give for 10 dirhams. That was crazy money for a 3 glasses of hot water ! We called for room service. Most of the items listed on menu card were not available in the kitchen. I requested them to cook it as I can wait. But they refused to cook. We finally ordered Indian curry, got the food which tasted good. I called room service to send some mint sauce or pickle (a usual thing given with all Indian dishes), but they said they have it but would charge 10 dirhams for it. That was the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard. I said no to it. When we checked in the hotel they kept our passport saying they will return them after scanning them, But when we called next day they said they will return only when we check out. I said I want it, but they denied, saying that it is our policy and cannot return it before checkout. WORST THING - on the second day morning when we reached the restaurant for buffet breakfast they stopped us from eating saying, sorry it is not included in your package. But we said that we had it yesterday, on which they said it was by mistake. And now we need to pay. By that time we were so disappointed with them, that did not even bother to check out booking details to see if breakfast was included or not in the room rent. When we were leaving, we wanted to give them feedback and mentioned that we had stayed with Ramada earlier, in other countries, and it has always been good, unlike this one, so why the difference in service. On that, reception simply replied with a smile, sorry we are not the same. And we said, you just replied our question.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: baldric8
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. My recommendation would be to pay just 10% more and get far more The hotel is very tired and the service is awful. I think the positive reviews have been written by either the management or their friends as I cannot believe what they have written

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceptive - not a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happy_tourister
Reviews.Content: First the good - clean hotel, decent front office and OK-OK (in politeness) front office staff. The location is decent as its near airport, Deira City Centre and Wafi Mall. But its also far from Dubai city centre, financial district and many big malls such as Mall of Emirates, Dubai Mall etc. Now, the bad (and many) Poor facilities with staff quite rude in replies. Charges for even basic room services such as hot drinking water, ice cubes, iron or kettle. In-hotel restaurants do not have items on menu most of times. Not all TV channels were shown despite having them on channel list of hotel. When asked why - different staff gave different excuses - ranging from no more in channel list, out of service for maintenance/technical issues to even "its banned by government". We asked if they have weighing scale (my mistake!), they were again rude in saying - What! No! Huh?! Sorry! (and I am sure they were not)! For the same price, you can get much better deals around the place. Overall, poor value for service. P.S. I clarified from the front desk staff - this is not the same "Ramada" as the world chain is - so do not go by "Ramada" reputation - this only shares the name but is not the same chain.

Reviews.Title: “AKRA Good property, pathetic service”
Reviews.Author: makra1
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Property is good also but service is very poor as most of the staff is Indians. Even butter was not present in breakfast and overall menu was small. shampoo were not being placed once used tube is lifted by housekeeping. A good indian club on the ground floor. Entry is free but once you seat they force you to order and give money to dancers for which no invoice is given. strage!. you can not sleep till 3AM due to clubs noise coming to your room.

Reviews.Title: “I really can't recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: Bagster
Reviews.Content: There are many good hotels in Dubai, but this is not one of them. The first thing you need to know is that there are massage services on the top floor and if that makes you suspicious, it should. There are also many Russian women in the bars and they're not there to promote Russian business interests. Of course, that may be what you want and if it is then look no further -- you've found it. I know no other Dubai hotel that tries to hold on to your passport until you check out, but this one does. If they try to keep yours, do what I did and demand it back. The law in the UAE requires them to take a copy of the page in your passport that has your entry stamp on it but it does not require that they keep it and there may be times on your trip when you need it. The food is not good at any time but breakfast is awful. The hotel has an unpleasant smell about it and it's the smell of dirt. The towels in your bathroom will be old and grey, the bed will be hard and the pillow will not help you to sleep. On the plus side, it's close to the airport; on the minus side it's a long way from main shopping and business areas. On the other hand, there's a Metro station right outside. It's cheap, but it isn't THAT cheap -- if you haggle before you arrive you don't have to pay much more to be in the Five Star Murooj Rotana and, if you want to be close to the airport, the Al Bustan Rotana is almost the same price (Yes, I'm a Rotana fan and I have a Rotana Rewards card but I'm not a Rotana employee or stooge). The Crowne Plaza is walking distance from the World Trade Centre if that's where you're heading, it's about the same price and it's a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Service and Attitude”
Reviews.Author: DharmeshN
Reviews.Content: We had a Banquet Event and everything was cleared and understood by both parties until the function begin. It was a Wedding Reception booked for 240 and less than 200 people turned up. - Starter were over even before 60% crowd could eat - Mike that was to be used to announce during the Bride and Grooms entry was not working, the incharge was asked to change it asap and he came only after 20 mins - Service Extremely Slow inspite of bringing it to the attention of the function incharge it never improved - Starter were discussed and agreed as Floating service or Pass around but these were pre plated and left on the Tables - We asked to reserve a few tables for close family, it was done but not controlled and hence the close family was not around the bride and the groom - As a part of the package we had a wedding cake and was requested for a chocolate truffle cake which was agreed upon with an email confirmation but a vanilla cake was brought instead - On the day of reception was Wakat Arafat so no music and no alcohol is allowed and we understand that but it wasn't notified to us prior and was told to us a day before the event. Which Inturn the Asst F n B Manager tells us to play music but at our risk. (which is so disrespectfull of the law) These were a few concerns raised by us to the event incharge and the Asst F n B Manager and very rudely we told these are tricks u people play at the end to have something comp off. That was the last thing and was very disrespectful and we didn't ask anything further instead just paid and left. The only last thing told to him was that I would like to meet the General Manager of the hotel along with the Asst F n B Manager he said, he would schedule an appointment and call me back and have heard nothing All in all what was promised and communicated was not delivered and after that the staff was not even courteous or appologitic they just behaved like nothings happening

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: FarzinKZ
Reviews.Content: It wasnot a good experience in Dubai. The beds were uncomfortable and the staff werenot friendly to guests. The breakfast buffet had not sufficient quality and the lunch was bad. But the price seems good. It is near to airport but far from shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: omer01
Reviews.Content: hotel was ok. rooms were small but comfortable. good breakfast but the location was bad... otherwise hotel was livable.

Reviews.Title: “My family loved it and we'll be back-hopefully”
Reviews.Author: DRJMA
Reviews.Content: I have visited Dubai several times in last 6 years and it is the 2nd time my stay at Ramada Continental, and this time with family. I have experienced several hotels in Dubai and stays at Ramada was comfortable (specially for my twins of aged 6) and affordable. The reception staff was extremely swift and polite, they arranged our lodging within 10 min of our arrival; when we went to our room, it was already made according to our desire. The room was good enough for four of us, bathroom was clean and had extra soaps and towels. In room, the TV has around 90 channels, all working. Room service was timely and according to specifiation, always came with full strength of cutlery sets and accessories. Room was cleaned daily, even when we forgot to mention it. Breakfast area was comfortable and clean with many thing to offer, well enough for 4 of us-staff was well-trained and polite, always helpful. Reception staff was always thorough and gave good advises (specially a lady manager-we forgot her name) when ever we needed some information about cabs, city area and shops. Bell boys were always quick to serve and polite. Cabs were available on the door steps of hotel. We will certainly be visiting Ramada again-if times allows.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: faraz001169
Reviews.Content: good value for money. great property. love to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerdxb88
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Everything is perfect and upto the standard....Nice staff also

Reviews.Title: “too far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: solid61
Reviews.Content: before booking,the clerk of travel agency told me this hotel is in a business location of Dubai ,but, its wrong and its too far of main Dubai!!!. they have not triples room,and they gave us one double room with one extra mattress.but the room was very small like a single room. this hotel contained 4 noisy night clubs,our room was on 4th floor but we couldn't sleep well because of night clubs. also after middle night you can see many night girl on lobby. so this is not a family hotel. food!!!!the restaurant is quiet but the tastes is awful.and the launch on each day is REPETITIVE.

Reviews.Title: “good city bad location bad service”
Reviews.Author: abiteheran
Reviews.Content: us was told this hotel has a good location but it is very diffrent. far away from rigga street were the most of hotels and clubs for nightliving is. the stuff is not realy friendly. its very clean and breakfeast and lunch is very good. if somebody wants to go to wildwadi its better to get the ticket from hotel. swimmingpool and gym is also clean.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: aghili2003
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family for 3 nights and we reserved 2 rooms one should be double bed for me and my wife and another should be twin for my 2 children but when they arrived they give us 2 doublebed room one room in the north side of 2th floor and another in the south! we said we are a family and our room should be close to each other but after some hour the give us another room at the 2th floor just a liitle bit nearer.room service was't good becuase when they brought us a cup of milk there was something floating in it and another time there was a small part of hair in the cup of milk.They gave no time any newspaper to us and the price of eeverything in the mini bar was very expensive for example a bottle of water in the shops was 1 derham but in the hotel was 12 derham!Foods was very aweful and one of the servants in the resturan was very rude and untaught person becaus one dat in the breakfast he brought for us 3 cup instead of 4 becuase we were 4 person and after 3 or 4 mentions he brought a cup without any appologize and again at the same time in another day he forgot to bring for us a spoon!another example was about intenet usning in the lobby when I asked one of the servants he said it is free of charge if we want to use internet but after 10 minutes the reception warned me it is not free and I had to pay 30 derhams without any logical reason.I'm very unsatisfied of this hotel and don't recommand to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: S0-A
Reviews.Content: It was a really good hotel.The rooms were spacious and well serviced and immaculately clean.The buffet meals were really good offering a variety of dishes including indian food and sea food.The only problem was that when we wanted to check out,they charged us for a chocolate saying that we had used the chocolate in the mini bar!!! The truth was that there was no chocolate in the mini bar when we had checked in.Anyway,this was the trick of the hotel and other passengers had faced the same problem.So just keep in mind to check all the items in the mini bar as soon as you arrive otherwise you have to pay for missing stuff.The hotel's location was quite good.It was close to the airport.We had no problem finding taxis.The swimming pool was also on the roof top and was worth using.There was also a gym that we didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “Price watch”
Reviews.Author: michelleberyl
Reviews.Content: A group of us (6) checked into the hotel on Thursday morning around 6am -we checked out again on Sunday morning at 10am. I went to settle my bill and found to my horror that they had charged me for 4 nights stay. I asked why this was so - the receptionist stated because we had checked in early we had to pay for four nights instead of three. I asked to see the manager who stated that this was their policy. Eventually got it sorted. Hotel too far from other Dubai activities - place is like a building site.There is a note in the rooms to this effect. Concierge staff excellent .Dirty water in rooms - no tea and coffee making facilities - drinks in bar subject to 10 % municipal tax and 10% service charge- you only know when your bill is presented. Owner of hotel has 5 cars underneath his hotel - Aston Martin , Ferrari, Toyotal Prado etc.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: doctorfoxtrot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3nights/4days to attend a conference in Burj Al Arab Hotel last week. Seems like staying in a 3-4 star hotel . Rooms are not that spacious but functional. It has comfortable beds, adequate mini bar and an LCD television. Airconditioning was satisfactory. Breakfast buffet not bad but the coffee shop can be chaotic at times when hotel guests arrive at the same time. Staff are multi racial who provide decent service. The place however is quite far from the major attractions. Traffic during peak hours only make it worse. Over all satisfied with what the hotel can offer. For me it is not a bad choice whether it is for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip Dubai - Ramada Average 2.5*'s”
Reviews.Author: Sean_Owens
Reviews.Content: Inadvertantly booked the Ramada Continental online, due to rates. Roughly $132 a night, inclusive of Internet Access and Breakfast, good deal for Dubai. Upon arrival, realized I'd stayed here the last time with tumultuous results. 1st Trip: My colleague and I arrived in Dubai after 14+ hours in Economy, from NYC. Had a few beverages at Blues and Cues (Sports Bar) on the Mezzanine Floor. Which, unfortunatley I happened to be staying directly above the bar. Loud, base felt in the bed, while sleeping. Ugh, breakfast included, but not until 6am, left at 5am. Horrble experience 1 Star. 2nd Trip - Inadvertant Reservation Booked 'em the 2nd time, because I didn't think, and didn't reckon it was the same place. They offer a shuttle service from the airport, which I highly recommend, saves you the 40+ DHM from the airport taxi, and they meet you right after customs in the arrivals hall. Check in was a pain, I'd reserved on Ramada.com, and got the $132 inclusive rate for Internet, Airport Transfer, and Breakfast, unfortunately most hotels charge you 100 - 125 dirhams for the Internet access, poor wireless at that. Argued that it was inclusive with my reservation, which I had to prove, rather than included in their reservation system. Watch out, they charge you for everything. After sorting out the Internet Challenge, and assuring a "quiet room" everything was smooth. No airport transfers before 6am, but a taxi at that time of the mornng is inexpensive comparatively. All in all, I'd rate the Ramada a 2.5 out of 5, C rating. Give you the basics, rooms are old, but clean, and the staff is nice. Unfortunately Customer Service is still being learned, as most are Philipino or Indian expats working here, still trying to learn the aspects of International Customer Service, though they are adamant about improving, and learning new skills. For a night/late/early meetings in Dubai, without all of the glitz, it's a pretty good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - bad location”
Reviews.Author: l3abboud
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel... i have stayed there for 5 nights. The rooms are spacious with average furniture, so are the bathrooms. However, the location is very bad.... it is very far from everything

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mitchsis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada Continental recently on business. Rooms are good size and immaculately clean and well serviced. Fresh fruit bowl, good mini bar and inoffensive 'corporate' decor. The hotel has a rooftop swimming pool, although sadly didn't get chance to try it out. Great for a sundown drink though. The Thai restaurant in the hotel is absolutely brilliant, the Indian restaurant is absolutely terrible. I had the worst curry I have ever tasted anywhere in the world. The foyer cafe was fantastic for lunch and breakfast. The hotel is close to the Gold Souk and the old parts of Dubai. I strongly suspect it is nowhere near as luxurious as the Jumeira hotels but I thought it was really very good.

Reviews.Title: “WOW ! What a Great Find !”
Reviews.Author: airline
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Dubai via Abu Dhabi. Checked-in at 2300 and was welcomed with a fruit juice while we waited for our check-in to be completed. Very courtious staff and from the minuet out taxi arrived we were made to feel welcome. We booked two exec rooms and could not believe how big the rooms were when the door opened we relised we had struck gold. They were actually suites. Very Large bedroom with a lounge area attatched and two bathrooms. We cannot praise the staff enough I fly for a living and stay all over the world in 5 Star hotels and I can honestly say that I have never stayed somewhere where we were made to feel welcome all the time and it was genuine. The hotel has 5 restaurants and are priced very reasonably.The only thing about this hotel is that if you are on floor 1 depending where you are located you can hear the night club the floor below. It should not prove a problem as you can only generally hear a faint thud now and again but to be honest with you it is worth it to have the pleasure of staying in this wonderful hotel. Centrally located in Deira near the airport and only about a 10 min taxi ride away from the gold souk and creek. Taxi fares are metered so a rough guide would be around 25 dirs £3.50 and the drivers do not expect tips either. This hotel is not near any building work either the majority is at Jumeriah Beach. This is a wonderful city and must to see while the buildings are going up. Will not hesitate to stay here again. Hope you choose this hotel and have a great time.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Continental Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Abu Hail Road, Deira | P.O.Box 31999, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
